data.title: Mrs. Doubtfire 30th Anniversary Film Review
data.meta_description: The film Mrs. Doubtfire (1993) is a childhood favorite, and I’ve gone back to watch it repeatedly. I’ve shown Mrs. Doubtfire to my children, and we’ve laughed together at Robin William’s antics as he…
data.text:
Warning: Spoilers Ahead

The film Mrs. Doubtfire (1993) is a childhood favorite, and I’ve gone back to watch it repeatedly. I’ve shown Mrs. Doubtfire to my children, and we’ve laughed together at Robin William’s antics as he portrays Daniel (an unemployed actor and father of three) and Mrs. Doubtfire (a man pretending to be a British nanny) in the film. Mrs. Doubtfire is more than a delightful comedy. It’s a family drama exploring the difficult issues of divorce and fatherhood.

In preparation for writing a 30th-anniversary film review for Mrs. Doubtfire, I watched a 25th-anniversary interview with four original cast members. Pierce Brosnan portrayed Daniel’s ex-wife Miranda’s new boyfriend Stuart, along with Matthew Lawrence, Lisa Jakub, and Mara Wilson (the three children). Robin Williams, who sadly died in 2014, and Sally Field, who portrayed Miranda, were not included in the interview.

During the interview, Brosnan recalled seeing Robin Williams in full costume as Mrs. Doubtfire for the first time and knowing then the film would be good. I can’t…
